name: vscode-animalese
description: Makes animal crossing sounds whenever you type. Highly customizable with very low latency, written with a Node.js adaptation of the Web Audio API.

vscode-animalese.volume.description: This value dictates, in percentage, how loud the animalese sounds should be.

vscode-animalese.voice.description: Determines the voice that will be talking. This setting only applies to alphanumerical characters.

vscode-animalese.specialPunctuation.markdownDescription: Overrides the default sounds for the keys `!`, `?`, and `Enter`.

vscode-animalese.soundOverride.markdownDescription: Replace **ALL** sounds with an absolute path to the given sound file.

vscode-animalese.intonation.louderUpperc.description: Indicates the percentage increase that uppercase letters will make, over lowercase letters. For example, if this value is 25, the volume of any uppercase letter will be 125%.

vscode-animalese.intonation.falloffTime.description: When a key is pressed, the audio slowly fades out over the course of the track. This value determines how many seconds it takes before the audio fully fades out.

vscode-animalese.intonation.disableFallo.description: If enabled, disables volume falloff completely, keeping volume constant throughout playback.

vscode-animalese.intonation.pitchShift.description: Fixed pitch shift in semitones. Positive values make sounds higher, negative values make them lower. Range: -12 to +12 semitones.

vscode-animalese.intonation.pitchVariati.markdownDescription: For any key except for vocal keys, randomly shift the pitch of the audio up or down by, at most, the amount of [cents](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cent_%28music%29) given.

vscode-animalese.intonation.switchToExpo.markdownDescription: If checked, the audio volume will fall off at an exponential rate instead of a linear one.
